H0.text: where was held the first session of muslim league. Dhaka

H1.text: where was held the first session of muslim league. Aligarh

H2.text: where was held the first session of muslim league. Lahore

H3.text: where was held the first session of muslim league. Lucknow

A4.text: The All-India Muslim League (AIML) was a political party established in Dhaka in 1906 when some well-known Muslim politicians met the Viceroy of India, Lord Minto, with the goal of securing Muslim interests in British India.

A5.text: The first stage of its formation was the meeting held at Lucknow in September 1906, with representatives from all over India in attendance.

A6.text: In 1906, the All India Muslim League was founded in the city during a conference on liberal education hosted by the Nawab of Dhaka and the Aga Khan III.
